basics.name: Kevin Li
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Software engineer with a passion for problem solving, an eye for detail, and a strong mathematics background. Well organized, prompt, attentive, adaptive, and works well within a team or on solo projects. Loves to tackle complex software problems. Interested in being part of innovative and technically challenging projects. Responsive to criticism and always looking for ways to improve as an engineer.

work.summary: Wyng is a marketing platform for brands and agencies to build and run campaigns that drive participation and elevate consumer influence. We powered the first Super Bowl hashtag commercial in 2011. Since then, we've continued to evolve our platform to align with shifts in consumer behavior through a robust library of campaign templates.
highlights: Technologies: Python, Django, Flask, Selenium, Javascript, jQuery, ReactJS, Redux, AngularJS, NodeJS, CSS, Less, Bootstrap, Material Design, HTML, Amazon Web Services, Apache, Vagrant, Docker, MySQL, MongoDB
Led the project for surfacing campaign performance to clients and provide clients with consumer insights throughout the lifetime of a campaign.
Create new features in the platform to increase the value being delivered to clients and improve their user experience.
Improve the platform's client onboarding process and user interface experience to drive higher engagement and retention within the platform.
Visually refresh the platform by building a new UI based on Material's design philosophy.
Modernize the platform by adopting modern technologies such as ReactJS and Redux.
Maintain, update, improve, and refactor existing legacy code.
Write user acceptance and unit tests.
JIRA, Confluence, Slack, and GitHub is used to manage and organize workflow processes.
Travis and Jenkins is used for continuous integration testing.
Work together in a team of software engineers.

work.summary: PivotalPath is a new model investment consultancy, bridging the gap that currently separates the interests of traditional investment consultants from those of CIOs.  Its investor portal, PivotalBase offers information and analysis on a distilled group of 850+ hedge funds including 200+ in-depth qualitative and quantitative assessments, along with a set of tools to navigate them. Advising on over $6.5 billion in hedge fund assets comprised of single and multi-family offices, pensions, endowments and foundations, PivotalPath provides services including investment due diligence, sourcing, portfolio construction, monitoring, and bespoke projects.
highlights: Help build and design the codebase from scratch.
Technologies: Python, Django, Java, Javascript, CSS, Bootstrap, HTML, MySQL, SQLite, Apache, Nginx, Amazon Web Services.
Work closely with the financial team to understand their use cases and the build tools for streamlining their research effort.
Develop an outward facing platform for clients to access and interact with the financial team's research efforts.
Develop an internal facing platform for the financial team to organize and manage their research process.
Setup and maintain the cloud infrastructure responsible for hosting PivotalPath's platform services.
JIRA, Confluence, HipChat, and GitHub is used to manage and organize workflow processes.
Work together in a team of software engineers.

work.summary: The Hospital Information Services Department of Maimonides Medical Center was responsible for maintaining the medical records of the patients at the Maimonides Medical Center. This included tasks such as identifying incomplete records, ensuring the results of tests and procedures were associated with the correct record, and acquiring the necessary approval or signatures from the appropriate physicians.
highlights: Maintain and organize medical records.
Identify medical records that were missing physician signatures or reviews.
Assist physicians in locating their patient's medical records.
Handle sensitive information daily with care and professionalism.
